climbs.name: Wapooita
climbs.fa: Matt Johnson, Troy Dixon, Chris Daniels, Manny Rangel

content.description: The first quarter has the crux on sidepulls and stems; the traverse up high is fun too. Great belay ledge.
content.protection: Single rack of cams to #4; sm-lg nuts, slings and QDs; bolted belays.
content.location: Center of West Face near thin pine head up a dihedral that deposits you at a roof (traverse right to ledge). Continue up easy rock to the right for a wider crack with easy climbing.

content.description: Getting started is the hardest part. Ascend the face to start then get protection in the dihedral above. If you don't mind squeeze, you'll love the final roof. Big holds and squeezing in the chimney make this an easier exit than it first appears.
content.protection: Standard rack plus double up cams #3-5, a single six helps. Chains, 60m rope.
content.location: The far left side of the West facing wall is a tall dihedral with a wide spot up high. Begin on a ledge that ends at the arÃªte.

content.description: Look for a second pine tree near the highest part of the base of the Buttress. Start below the second pine growing low on the wall. Climb an easy but sparsely protected broken ramp up and left to a piton and the base of the upper dihedral. Continue up and right on blocky terrain to the vertical crack above. After the crux start of the upper dihedral, the cracks ease up considerably. As you exit walk left/north to anchor behind shrub. Descend with two rappel on Wapooita.
content.protection: Double rack (.3-3 cams), nuts, slings and quick draws (12). One piton.
content.location: At right side of wall, start below upper dihedrals near Pine tree on the wall. Easy climbing up and left (sparse protection) gets you to top of ramp and piton. Descent via Wapooita anchor (left of top out). Two rappels with 60m rope.

content.description: This golden dihedral is on the left edge of the Buttress. Easy broken face leaves the bolt (good for the belayer too) and gains the start of the crack. Good protection and fun climbing for 30m get you to the shiny anchors. Rap w/single 60m. You can continue to the top to Wapooita anchor on west face.
content.protection: Double rack from #1-4, single #5, sm-lg nuts, slings and QD
content.location: Walk up to the northeast facing shoulder of the Tonto Buttress, it's nice and clean with little lichen on golden granite. Look for a clean face with zero lichen on left shoulder of the Buttress.

climbs.name: Apacheria
climbs.fa: Mike Knarzer, Manny Rangel, Jared Bryant, Matt Johnson

content.description: The route ascends directly to the headwall between Wapooita and Chuntz. The crux comes near the top as you pass a couple of overhangs.
content.protection: ten bolts, use Wapooita anchors (walk to left or shrub) and rappel
content.location: Start near center of Buttress, look for bolt above alcove.

content.description: This cliff has a wide west face and narrow left shoulder. Charlie Pan dihedral ascends the clean rock up a long dihedral to the top. The West face has several potential lines.
